text:
Is it worth shaving a member and how to do it right
01 Nov 2019, 19:15 by Ekaterina Komissarova
Spoiler: certainly worth it! If you are ready for possible troubles.
Getting rid of hair on the intimate parts of the body is more than popular. Thus, the editors of the American edition of Men‚Äôs Health, having interviewed more than a thousand respondents, found *: vegetation on the penis and testicles is removed from time to time by 62% of men. True, not everyone does it right - and then suffer. Though not too long, but thorough. * Source: The State of the American Penis Survey
Why shave dick and scrotum
There is no practical need to shave the hair from the penis and testicles. That pubic haircut is really justified. The hair there is thick, the skin under them sweats easily, and even sweat here from apocrine sweat glands. A little bit of physical exertion - the groin starts to smell unpleasant: and then, lingering on the hairs, and the waste products of bacteria, the nursery of which becomes wet vegetation. In general, for hygiene reasons, the pubis should be trimmed.
A member and a scrotum is a completely different matter. Firstly, there is not enough hair there. Secondly, apocrine glands are also significantly less than on the pubis. Therefore, shaving the testicles and penis is aesthetic rather than carrying any hygienic meaning.
However, smoothness and beauty are also a good reason to shave. Keep in mind that this desire sometimes has unpleasant side effects.
Why don't you shave your dick and scrotum
Because you are very likely to get in your pants what is called a "pineapple penis." According to the definition of * Urban Dictionary, a popular dictionary of English-language slang, "pineapple" occurs when a man completely shaves off his hair in the intimate area, and then they begin to grow back. Outwardly, it looks like a prickly surface of a tropical fruit, hence the name. * Source: Pineapple Penis
After shaving, the penis and testicles are pricked and itchy, and this lasts 1-2 weeks until the hair grows back. But "pineapple" is not the only side effect.
46% of men have injured themselves at least once during intimate shaving. This is reported * by an online study involving more than 1,200 respondents. * Source: Manscaping: a detailed look into mowing your personal lawn
Here are the main troubles fraught with shaving of the penis and scrotum (however, similar consequences can be obtained when removing hair from the pubis):

Cuts. They are not only painful, but can also be channels for infection.
The appearance of ingrown hairs (pseudofolliculitis). They are often accompanied by inflammation and the formation of unaesthetic, pus-filled acne.
Skin irritation.

All in all, the fairly high fees for luxury boast perfectly smooth skin. However, there are still ways to minimize the risk. About them - below.
How to shave a member and a scrotum, if you still want to
The most competent and safest way to get rid of vegetation in this area is to contact a cosmetology salon that provides such a service. But of course, of course - shy. Yes, and not cheap.
If you still decide to work on the beauty of the penis and testicles with your own hands, follow certain safety rules.
1. Buy a separate razor for intimate areas
In no case do not shave the penis with the same machine that you process your face or armpits. In the intimate zone live bacteria that are not on other parts of the body, and it is better not to transfer them.
2. Shorten your hair with scissors or a trimmer before shaving
Long hair is harder to shave. They can get stuck inside the blade and increase the risk of cuts. In general, trim them to a height of about 1 cm in advance.
3. Take a warm bath or shower
Heat relaxes tiny muscles attached to hair follicles and softens hair.
4. Use shaving oil
Put it on the testicles and penis, and only after that use the usual cream or foam. Oil will make your skin smoother and shave softer.
5. Shave your hair in stages
In areas, tightly pulling the skin on each of them. Any wrinkle or tubercle - and a cut is almost guaranteed to you.
Small life hack: if you can‚Äôt tighten your skin, stimulate an erection. Thanks to this, the surface will become smooth.
6. Do not rush, be careful
One awkward or hasty movement - and you will have to glue a patch on the intimate area. And then not one.
Do not forget to clean the razor from hair accumulated on it as often as possible.
7. Get ready for cuts.
They may appear even if you are super careful. In this case, wash the injured area with warm, soapy water, disinfect (e.g. chlorhexidine), and place a piece of toilet paper on top to stop the bleeding.
Attention! If the blood continues to flow even after 10 minutes or beats with pulsating streams, call an ambulance. For deep cuts, stitching is required.
8. When done, flush the penis and testicles with cool water
A cool shower will narrow your pores and reduce your risk of irritation. Then blot the shaved area with a soft towel.
9. Apply lotion or after shave balm
Ideal - with aloe extract or camphor. Such a tool will help moisturize the skin and again reduce the risk of irritation.
Use lotion or balm after morning and evening showers for at least 2-3 days after shaving.
10. Be prepared for irritation and itching.
Unfortunately, this is not insured by attentiveness when shaving, or leaving after. If the skin continues to itch a few days after the procedure, and even more so if inflammation and ulcers appear on it, be sure to consult a dermatologist. Your doctor will prescribe a suitable treatment for you.
